snippet: The annual consumer price inflation rate jumped to 2.7 percent in October, raising doubts that the Bank of England would move to stimulate growth any time soon.
abstract: Britain's fragile economic recovery is running into the familiar problem of inflation, threatening to impede gains; annual consumer price inflation rate jumped to 2.7 percent in October, raising doubts that the Bank of England will move to stimulate growth any time soon.
lead_paragraph: The annual consumer price inflation rate jumped to 2.7 percent in October, raising doubts that the Bank of England would move to stimulate growth any time soon.

headline.seo: British Inflation Rate Jumps to 2.7 Percent
headline.main: British Inflation Jumps on Food and Tuition Costs
headline.print_headline: Inflation May Impede Recovery In Britain
